alert.note: Alert for Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 27 at 5:41PM MST until February 28 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH 6 PM MST TUESDAY EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO VERY WINDY AND DRY CONDITIONS... .Winds will subside this evening allowing for today`s Red Flag Warning to expire. Winds will strengthen again Tuesday across much of the area and the combination of very windy and dry conditions will bring several hours of critical fire weather conditions to the eastern plains. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MST TUESDAY... * AREA AND TIMING... Northeast Plains (Zone 104) from Tuesday late morning through Tuesday early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...14 to 18 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
